sentences.english: He uses the power of nature to damage and inhibit his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他使用自然之力去傷害並抑止他的敵人。

sentences.english: Can also restrain the alloy steel as the fire caused brittle.
sentences.chinese: 還能夠抑止合金鋼由於火而惹起的脆性。

sentences.english: China's leaders say fighting rising inflation is also a priority.
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人稱，抑止通貨膨脹也是頭等大事。

sentences.english: And, sooner or later, spending will have to be restrained to reduce the balance of payments deficit.
sentences.chinese: 同時，遲早的事情，消費將受到抑止以減少支付虧損。

sentences.english: Bertha repressed her gaiety and began to eat .
sentences.chinese: 伯莎抑止住逗樂的情緒，開始喫飯。

sentences.english: I brought him over to my drawings and he burst out laughing when he saw them.
sentences.chinese: 我帶給他我的畫作，他見到它們之後不可抑止地大笑。

sentences.english: Standardization of information definition can check availably non-criterion definition to deluge.
sentences.chinese: 信息定義的標準化可以有效抑止不規範定義的泛濫。

sentences.english: Alcohol can inhabit the excretion of uric acid.
sentences.chinese: 酒精可以抑止尿酸的排泄。

definition: to hold back/to check (i.e. to stop sb's advance)/to resist/esp. with negative, irresistible, unstoppable etc
cannot control oneself (idiom)/to be beside oneself
shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
to wriggle/(fig.) to stir up trouble/(of a sentiment) to stir
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
